meanings.definition: The state of being alone or solitary.
meanings.sent1: Her loneness was palpable as she sat by herself at the lunch table.
meanings.sent2: The loneness of the old man was evident in his empty house.
meanings.sent3: The loneness of the cat made it meow loudly for attention.
meanings.sent4: The loneness of the desert stretched endlessly in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The loneness of the forest at night was both eerie and beautiful.

meanings.definition: The quality of lacking companionship or being isolated.
meanings.sent1: The loneness of the new student was evident in her shy demeanor.
meanings.sent2: The loneness of the abandoned house gave it a haunting aura.
meanings.sent3: The loneness of the sock without its pair made it feel incomplete.
meanings.sent4: The loneness of the iceberg floating in the vast ocean was striking.
meanings.sent5: The loneness of the empty playground echoed with silence.
